issue.message: "occured" is a common misspelling; did you mean "occurred" ?

On SDK version 23 and up, your app data will be automatically backed up, and restored on app install. Your GCM regid will not work across restores, so you must ensure that it is excluded from the back-up set. Use the attribute `android:fullBackupContent` to specify an `@xml` resource which configures which files to backup. More info: https://developer.android.com/training/backup/autosyncapi.html
The resource `R.drawable.swimming` appears to be unused
This `LinearLayout` layout or its `RelativeLayout` parent is possibly useless; transfer the `background` attribute to the other view

The image `icon.png` varies significantly in its density-independent (dip) size across the various density versions: mipmap-hdpi/icon.png: 48x48 dp (72x72 px), mipmap-mdpi/icon.png: 48x48 dp (48x48 px), mipmap-xhdpi/icon.png: 48x48 dp (96x96 px), mipmap-xxhdpi/icon.png: 48x48 dp (144x144 px), mipmap-xxxhdpi/icon.png: 128x128 dp (512x512 px)
Found bitmap drawable `res/drawable/swimming.png` in densityless folder
Missing the following drawables in `drawable-mdpi`: ic_layers_gray.png (found in drawable-hdpi)
Missing the following drawables in `drawable-xhdpi`: ic_layers_gray.png (found in drawable-hdpi)
Missing the following drawables in `drawable-xxhdpi`: ic_layers_gray.png (found in drawable-hdpi)
App is not indexable by Google Search; consider adding at least one Activity with an ACTION-VIEW intent filter. See issue explanation for more details.
